title: Chelsea, Michigan
text:
Chelsea is a <a href="List%20of%20cities%2C%20villages%2C%20and%20townships%20in%20Michigan">city</a> in <a href="Washtenaw%20County%2C%20Michigan">Washtenaw County</a> in the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Michigan">Michigan</a>. The population was 5,467 at the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20Census">2020 census</a>.
In March 2004 by a 995–226 vote, residents approved a change in municipal status from a village into a city. Residents no longer pay property taxes to adjacent <a href="Lima%20Township%2C%20Michigan">Lima</a> and <a href="Sylvan%20Township%2C%20Washtenaw%20County%2C%20Michigan">Sylvan townships</a> as they had under the village government. The city provides all services formerly provided by both village and township governments.
Geography.
According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, the city has a total area of , of which is land and is water.
Climate.
This <a href="climate">climatic</a> region has large, varying seasonal temperature differences, with warm to hot (and often humid) summers and cold (sometimes severely cold) winters. According to the <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20Climate%20Classification">Köppen Climate Classification</a> system, Chelsea has a <a href="humid%20continental%20climate">humid continental climate</a>, abbreviated "Dfb" on climate maps.
Demographics.
2010 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2010, there were 4,944 people, 2,224 households, and 1,284 families living in the city. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was . There were 2,436 housing units at an average density of . The racial makeup of the city was 96.1% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.4% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.3% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native American</a>, 1.1% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 0.6% from <a href="Race%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 1.5% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 2.5% of the population.
There were 2,224 households, of which 28.1% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 46.2% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 8.8% had a female householder with no husband present, 2.8% had a male householder with no wife present, and 42.3% were non-families. 37.2% of all households were made up of individuals, and 21.9% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.18 and the average family size was 2.91.
The median age in the city was 43.5 years. 22.7% of residents were under the age of 18; 4.7% were between the ages of 18 and 24; 24% were from 25 to 44; 25.9% were from 45 to 64; and 22.7% were 65 years of age or older. The gender makeup of the city was 45.5% male and 54.5% female.
2000 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 4,398 people, 1,840 households, and 1,133 families living in the village. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 1,315.3 per square mile (508.4/km2). There were 1,913 housing units at an average density of 572.1 per square mile (221.1/km2). The racial makeup of the village was 97.14% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.70% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.27% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native American</a>, 0.48% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 0.07% <a href="Pacific%20Islander%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Pacific Islander</a>, 0.39% from <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 0.95% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 0.82% of the population.
There were 1,840 households, out of which 29.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 48.3% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 10.9% had a female householder with no husband present, and 38.4% were non-families. 35.4% of all households were made up of individuals, and 19.7% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.27 and the average family size was 2.95.
In the village the population was spread out, with 23.6% under the age of 18, 5.2% from 18 to 24, 25.0% from 25 to 44, 22.2% from 45 to 64, and 24.0% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 43 years. For every 100 females, there were 82.9 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 75.0 males.
The median income for a household in the village was $51,132, and the median income for a family was $72,266. Males had a median income of $50,506 versus $35,579 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the village was $27,609. About 2.5% of families and 4.3% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 2.9% of those under age 18 and 5.0% of those age 65 or over.
Education.
Chelsea residents typically send their children to public institutions, including North Creek Elementary School (formerly North Elementary), South Meadows Elementary School (formerly South Elementary), Pierce Lake Elementary School (now closed), <a href="Dwight%20E.%20Beach">Dwight E. Beach</a> Middle School, and <a href="Chelsea%20High%20School%20%28Michigan%29">Chelsea High School</a>.
Economy.
Chelsea Milling, maker of <a href="Jiffy%20Mix">Jiffy Mix</a>, is based in Chelsea. Other employers include <a href="Saint%20Joseph%20Mercy%20Health%20System">Saint Joseph Mercy Chelsea</a>, the <a href="Chrysler%20Proving%20Grounds">Chrysler Proving Grounds</a>, and the <a href="Special%20Alternative%20Incarceration%20Facility">Special Alternative Incarceration Facility</a>.
Awards.
In 2008, Chelsea District Library was named Best Small Library in America by <a href="Library%20Journal">Library Journal</a>.
